etymology.description: 犬 “dog” + 自 “nose”, referring to a dog's strong sense of smell; original form of 嗅 “to smell”.
etymology.interpretation: Dog and nose combine to depict the act or sense of smelling, evoking the association with odors. The original idea was simply “to smell,” which later developed a common nuance of “bad smell” or “stink.”

examples.chinese: 这里太臭了(這裡太臭了)。
鱼放久了会发臭(魚放久了會發臭)。
examples.pinyin: Yú fàng jiǔ le huì fā chòu.
examples.english: Fish left out too long will start to stink.

examples.chinese: 厕所很臭(廁所很臭)，赶紧开窗(趕緊開窗)。
examples.pinyin: Cèsuǒ hěn chòu, gǎnjǐn kāi chuāng.
examples.english: The bathroom stinks; quickly open the window.
